meanings.definition: Becoming smaller in size or amount.
meanings.sent1: The shrinking violet tried to hide in the corner.
meanings.sent2: The shirt was too big, so she put it in the dryer to make it shrinking.
meanings.sent3: The shrinking ice cream cone looked like it was trying to escape.
meanings.sent4: The shrinking shadows signaled the approaching sunset.
meanings.sent5: The shrinking balloon slowly lost its air and floated to the ground.

meanings.sent1: The shrinking of the cake indicated it was almost gone.
meanings.sent2: She noticed the shrinking of the lake as the drought continued.
meanings.sent3: The shrinking of the crowd made it easier to find her friends.
meanings.sent4: The shrinking of the map revealed hidden details.
meanings.sent5: The shrinking of the budget meant they had to cut costs.

meanings.definition: To draw back or cower in fear or timidity.
meanings.sent1: The dog began shrinking away from the loud noise.
meanings.sent2: She felt herself shrinking from the intimidating presence.
meanings.sent3: The cat pretended to be shrinking from the tiny mouse.
meanings.sent4: He was shrinking from the responsibility of leading the team.
meanings.sent5: The child started shrinking back when scolded by the teacher.
